byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Gregory Hooker, Iraq intelligence analyst for United States Central Command, is revealed to be leader of group accusing senior analysts of putting inaccurate and overly positive spin on reports assessing status of fight against Islamic State; Hooker also led criticisms of George W Bush administration's handling of 2003 Iraq invasion; investigation has called into question trustworthiness of command's assessments, which are fed to Congress, policy makers and the American public.
lead_paragraph: In some ways, the Iraq team’s latest criticism mirrors the disputes of a decade ago, when the Bush administration, over many analysts’ objections, advocated a small force in Iraq.

headline.main: Military Analyst Again Raises Red Flags on Progress in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Military Analyst Again Raises Red Flags on Progress in Iraq

snippet: In some ways, the Iraq team’s latest criticism mirrors the disputes of a decade ago, when the Bush administration, over many analysts’ objections, advocated a small force in Iraq.
